intro: Eudonax, commonly known as the common eudonax, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a rough texture. Eudonax is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its resilience to environmental stress.
